comments.body:
This is specializing the backing storage to use googles cloud filesystems.  IMHO if you're creating an image for the community this should be abstracted. 

@mattf @wattsteve

Are you sure? There are [multiple](https://www.concur.com/blog/en-us/spark-mesos-on-google-cloud) [sites](https://cloud.google.com/hadoop/google-cloud-storage-connector) that seem to indicate this configuration simply makes the `gs://` URI implementation known.

The conversation piece we discussed yesterday is how to pass in the configs.  By default this enables some fs options, when in reality you want the user to explicitly specify the options.  Gluster, Tachyon, Orange, etc.  

A much more general option is to create a pattern for either mounting configs or enabling side-car containers.
